column4: France orders Microsoft to stop collecting excessive user data
column5: BRUSSELS The French data protection authority on Wednesday ordered Microsoft Corp to stop collecting excessive data on users of its Windows 10 operating system and serving them personalised ads without their consent.

column4: UPDATE 2-France orders Microsoft to stop collecting excessive user data
column5: * Microsoft ordered to stop tracking Windows users without consent

column4: US STOCKS-Microsoft helps Wall St to another day of record highs
column5: * Indexes up: Dow 0.19 pct  S&P 0.43 pct  Nasdaq 1.06 pct   (Updates with close of U.S. market)

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Microsoft leads Wall St to fresh record highs
column5: NEW YORK  July 20 Wall Street gained on Wednesday  and the S&P 500 and Dow industrials set fresh records  as Microsoft's strong results boosted indexes and gave the latest sign that U.S. corporate earnings season may be less dour than feared.

column4: US STOCKS-Microsoft  Morgan Stanley lift Dow  S&P to records
column5: * Indexes up: Dow 0.22 pct  S&P 0.44 pct  Nasdaq 0.97 pct   (Adds details  changes quotes  updates prices)

column5: * Indexes up: Dow 0.01 pct  S&P 0.08 pct  Nasdaq 0.43 pct   (Updates to open)

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P  Dow hit new peaks on strong earnings
column5: July 20 The S&P 500 and the Dow touched new highs at the open on Wednesday  extending a record-setting rally  after Morgan Stanley and Microsoft  reported strong quarterly results.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures rise on Morgan Stanley  Microsoft results
column5: July 20 U.S. stock index futures were higher on Wednesday  with the Dow industrials on track for its ninth straight day of gains  as results from Morgan Stanley and Microsoft helped spur investor optimism regarding the health of corporate earnings.

column4: Tesla's data collection may help it deflect Autopilot liability
column5: NEW YORK The large volume of data Tesla Motors Inc collects from its cars on the road has armed it with information to publicly counter  and possibly legally defend  claims about the safety of its Autopilot driving-assist software  according to lawyers familiar with such cases.

column4: UPDATE 2-Daimler AG  Ferrari selling some new vehicles with faulty air bags -U.S. Senate report
column5: WASHINGTON  July 20 Daimler AG's Mercedes-Benz USA and Daimler Vans units and Ferrari NV are among a small group of automakers selling some new vehicles with faulty Takata airbags that will be subject to recalls by the end of 2018  a U.S. Senate report said on Wednesday.

column4: Intel's slowing data center growth overshadows strong profit
column5: Intel Corp  on Wednesday reported slower revenue growth at its data center business  which makes semiconductors used in high-end servers  overshadowing a better-than-expected quarterly profit.

column4: UPDATE 2-Intel's slowing data center growth overshadows strong profit

column4: BRIEF-Intel reports Q2 revenue of $13.5 billion
column5: * Quarterly reported non-GAAP operating income of $3.2 billion  net income of $2.9 billion and EPS of 59 cents

column4: Intel's quarterly revenue rises 2.6 percent
column5: July 20 Intel Corp reported a 2.6 percent rise in quarterly revenue  boosted by strong sales of its microchips that power data centers and Internet-connected devices.

column4: Strong demand from China buoys Qualcomm forecast
column5: Qualcomm Inc forecast current-quarter profit largely above market estimates as it sees strong demand for its mobile chips in China and expects to sign more licensing deals.

column4: UPDATE 2-Strong demand from China buoys Qualcomm forecast
column5: July 20 Qualcomm Inc forecast current-quarter profit largely above market estimates as it sees strong demand for its mobile chips in China and expects to sign more licensing deals.

column4: Qualcomm revenue rises 3.6 percent
column5: July 20 Qualcomm Inc reported a 3.6 percent rise in quarterly revenue  driven by strong demand for its flagship Snapdragon processors used in smartphones.
